org.azeckoski.reflectutils.transcoders
Interface Transcoder

All Known Implementing Classes:
HTMLTranscoder, JSONTranscoder, XMLTranscoder
public interface Transcoder

The transcoder can convert from a java objects => a format => java objects (simple)
Note that conversion to simple objects is all that is generally supported, conversions to complex objects require use of the ReflectUtils to handle the conversion using ReflectUtils.populate(Object, Map) or ReflectUtils.convert(Object, Class)
The ability to append optional properties is also supported
The various transcoders will also have optional configuration parameters which should be controlled via the constructors.
Transcoders should be written to be created once and used many times without problems.

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

Field Summary
static String DATA_KEY
          default map key to use if the output data is not actually a map but is a list or array or whatever when it is being decoded into a map

Field Detail

DATA_KEY

static final String DATA_KEY
default map key to use if the output data is not actually a map but is a list or array or whatever when it is being decoded into a map

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getHandledFormat

String getHandledFormat()
Returns:
the handled format (xml, json, etc.)

encode

String encode(Object object,
              String name,
              Map<String,Object> properties)
Parameters:
object - any java object (should not be null)
name - (optional) the name of the data, will be handled differently by the encoders (null for default: DATA_KEY)
properties - (optional) additional properties which will be added to the encoding as if it were a property of the bean or map being encoded, if the object being encoded is not a bean or a map then the properties are ignored
Returns:
the object encoded into the handled format

decode

Map<String,Object> decode(String string)
Decode the data string into a map of java objects (typically simple objects like String, Integer, etc.)

Parameters:
string - a string in the handled format
Returns:
the map of java objects based on the data string, this will not attempt to convert XML into beans but will simply convert data into maps or lists or simple java objects (strings, etc.), if there is only a single simple value then it will be placed into the map with the key "data"
